ygData.subject: RE: grimrot
ygData.msgSnippet: Schweeeett... When I played UO, I had two accounts and ALWAYS had two players on. Had a GM Blacksmith on one accountt hat I used, plus my Warrior Mage
ygData.messageBody:
Schweeeett... When I played UO, I had two accounts and ALWAYS had two
players on. Had a GM Blacksmith on one accountt hat I used, plus my Warrior
Mage characters on the other... Damage shield is an excellent idea for TRUE
Powergaming.... Well done on the Super Twink! (Miss a bit of the fun
though...heh).

-----Original Message-----
From: Doug Warren [mailto:dwarren@...]
Sent: Tuesday, August 24, 1999 1:23 PM
To: EQCheats@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQCheats] grimrot


Lord Grimrot is a rare spawn and also spawns in two incarnations. The Human
Shadowknight (What you saw) is L35 and usually carrys the Opaline Scythe (No
drop SK/Warrior only weapon.) Or sometimes he spawns in a lower level
(L25?) skeleton form. In either case when he spawns shout that he's out and
see if someone wants to kill him, then wait 24 norrathian hours. After that
time if he isn't dead he will de-spawn. BTW: One reason I've been so quiet
lately is I've been massivly twinking a new character. Also the reason I
know about the above information (Particuarlly the de-spawn.) I have 3
computers capable of playing eq next to eachother, and on one I have a
friends L39 druid, on the other my newbie. Walk into the skel fields at L8,
put Skin like diamonds, shield of spikes on the newbie, have him trigger all
the putrids, and watch them kill thesmelves on
the damage shield. Only two things need to watch out for. First is healnig
of course. Second is, you don't get exp for a monster unless you damage it
first. So if something dies on just the shield, no xp. So either cast an
AoE, or make sure to target what's hitting you and melee it once in turn.
Another interesting thing I learned is unless you piss them off, only 3
monsters will attack you at once. Using the above methods, I've raised from
1 to 20 in maybe 22 hours of real playing time. Knwoing what I know now, I
could do it even faster. (I experimented for an hour or two at places that
didn't pay off.) The bigest downside is that right now I'm spending about 3
hours raising spell skills that i never used. Try explaining to people why
their cleric can't cast SPirit Armour because they only have a 20
Abjuration!
